title: The popular shows returning to TV in 2020 including Married At First Sight and The Block
text:
Channel Nine has revealed the exciting and new range of titles set to hit television screens in 2020.

From the highly-anticipated seventh season of Married At First Sight to the sixteenth season of The Block, there will be plenty of shows to keep you entertained.

MAFS is set to kick off the year with relationship experts John Aiken, Mel Schilling and Trisha Stratford returning as matchmakers.

Grab the popcorn! Network Nine has revealed the exciting range of popular titles returning to screens in 2020 including The Block

There will be 20 brave singles paired from across Australia who are all determined to find their soulmate.

Also airing on Network Nine is Lego Masters, after the show proved to be a smash-hit this year with more than 2.3 million viewers tuning in for the final episode.

Australia's best Lego builders will compete against one other to create extraordinary designs using blocks.

Will they find love? Married At First Sight is set to kick off the year with relationship experts John Aiken, Mel Schilling and Trisha Stratford returning as matchmakers

The Voice will also make a return in 2020 with judges Kelly Rowland, Delta Goodrem, Guy Sebastian and Boy George all coming back.

Meanwhile, the wait will be over for The Block fans as the popular renovation show is set to come back.

The show will be moving to the affluent Melbourne bayside suburb of Brighton and applications for potential Blockheads are currently open.

Who will win? Ninja Warrior will return with a new location, new obstacles, a top prize of $400,000 and a knockout challenge for the best competitors

Audiences will also be able to enjoy watching some of Australia's fittest and fastest athletes try to complete the most infamous obstacle course on Ninja Warrior.

In 2020, the phenomenon will return with a new location, new obstacles, a top prize of $400,000 and a knockout challenge for the best competitors.

Meanwhile, Hamish and Andy's 'Perfect' Holiday will see the comedy duo conquer North America and complete challenging activities

The wait is over: Hamish and Andy's 'Perfect' Holiday will see the comedy duo conquer North America and complete challenging activities

Entertainment: New documentaries will air including medical series Emergency, Seven Worlds One Planet with David Attenborough (pictured) and Taronga: Who's Who In The Zoo

Fan favourites including Doctor Doctor, Paramedics, RBT and Travel Guides will also return.

Network Nine is also set to introduce a range of new and exciting shows.

Australian drama's Halifax: Retribution and Informer 3838 will both make their debut this year.

New show The Parent Jury, which sees mothers and fathers putting their parenting styles to the test, and variety show Step Back in Time will also premiere.

A number of documentaries will also air including medical series Emergency, Seven Worlds, One Planet with David Attenborough and Taronga: Who's Who In The Zoo.
description: Network Nine has revealed the exciting and new range of  titles set to hit television screens in 2020.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
